ai_info: Alien / Corpulent / Creepy / Eager / Friendly / Glitched / Listless / Old / Proud / Violent
analyse_description: Analyse a person, record, or item with close scrutiny to gather information and apply knowledge; gain a deeper understanding; do research.
autofill_reminder_craft: To generate craft abilities, upgrades, and modules, enter the name of the craft type above:
autofill_reminder_playbook: To generate playbook abilities and items,, enter the name of the playbook above:
background_info: Alien / Earther relic / Esoteric offshoot / Engineered / Uplifted
biology_info: Low Tech / Desert / Agri-world / Water world / Orbital / Craft-born / Urban / Rich / Scholarly / Ice world / War-torn
broken_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with technical skill or cold calculation.
cannibal_craft_core_upgrade_desc: A large, empty cavity that extends most of the length of the craft, filled with huge magnets, winches, automated saws, and so on, all behind a seal-able “mouth”. Eating a full wreck takes just weeks, yielding 2/3 of the wreck's value in Profit, rounded up.
cannibal_craft_xp_condition: You executed a successful scrapping, salvage, or sabotage operation.
chat_image: Image to show alongside chat rolls
command_description: Command obedience with your force of personality; intimidate or threaten.
consort_description: Consort with connections, friends, or rivals to gain access to resources, information, people, or places.
craft_ability_all_hands_desc: During downtime, one of your cohorts may perform a downtime activity for the crew to acquire an asset, reduce Chaos, or work on a long-term project.
craft_ability_belly_of_the_beast_desc: So long as you have a craft held in the Gullet, you get +1d to command its crew.
craft_ability_blood_money_desc: You get +2 Profit for battle or extortion scores. Your cowed victims pay you tribute in the form of several tonnes of minerals, oxygen, water, and precious metals, praying that this might appease you.
craft_ability_break_a_few_eggs_desc: You may take 0 stress when you do the math to kill in pursuit of salvage.
craft_ability_brothers_in_arms_desc: When you fight alongside your cohorts in combat, they get +1d for teamwork rolls (setup and group actions). All of your cohorts get the Soldiers type for free (if they're already Soldiers, add another type).
craft_ability_creatures_of_the_night_des: Each PC may add +1 action rating to Hunt, Sneak, or Hack (up to a max rating of 3).
craft_ability_decoys_desc: Every crew member has a life-like android decoy. When you resist a consequence, you may retroactively state that your decoy has actually taken your place. Each decoy counts as an Expert when acting alone. Destroyed decoys can be restored by spending a downtime action. Make sure to put your decoy on ice between scores, though – leave one running around on their own for too long, and they'll start to get ideas.
craft_ability_forget_me_now_desc: During downtime, take -1 Chaos in the current system. When a system's Chaos is 4 or less, you get +1d to deceive people when you pass yourselves off as ordinary locals.
craft_ability_hunter/killer_desc: You can apply the stealth tag to light-fabbed items for free, and you get +1d to hunt or scan with them as well as sneak.
craft_ability_interlopers_desc: When you execute a clandestine infiltration, you get +1d to the engagement roll.
craft_ability_just_a_number_desc: When you do the math to inflict harm at or above Scale 7, take -1 stress.
craft_ability_magpies_desc: The guts of the Core are a jumble of stolen or salvaged items. When you roll to acquire an asset, take +1d.
craft_ability_nuclear_option_desc: You can apply the nuclear tag to light-fabbed items for free, and you get +1d to fight or hunt with them.
craft_ability_plague_of_locusts_desc: Your cohorts with the Techs type get +1 Scale and +1 quality.
craft_ability_scavengers_desc: Each PC may add +1 action rating to Scramble, Analyse, or Operate (up to a max rating of 3).
craft_ability_scrap_eaters_desc: Each PC has been toughened by cruel experience. You get +1d to resistance rolls.
craft_ability_sword_of_heaven_desc: So long as you have your craft's weapon systems trained on a planet, you get +1d to command its frightened populace.
craft_ability_synchronised_desc: When you perform a group action, you may count multiple 6s from different rolls as a critical success.
craft_ability_tactical_superiority_desc: When you execute an assault plan, take +1d to the engagement roll.
craft_ability_the_ends_justify_the_means: When you do the math, you only take stress if you get a 1- 3 result.
craft_ability_veteran_desc: Choose a special ability from another craft (can be taken more than once).
craft_ability_war_mongers_desc: Each PC may add +1 action rating to Fight, Hunt, or Command (up to a max rating of 3).
craft_background_info: Alien / Ancient / Mothballed / Retrofitted wreck / Revered / Reviled / Stolen
craft_upgrade_elite_aces_desc: All of your cohorts with the Aces type get +1d to quality rolls for Aces-related actions.
craft_upgrade_elite_agents_desc: All of your cohorts with the Agents type get +1d to quality rolls for Agents-related actions.
craft_upgrade_elite_soldiers_desc: All of your cohorts with the Soldiers type get +1d to quality rolls for Soldier-related actions.
craft_upgrade_elite_techs_desc: All of your cohorts with the Techs type get +1d to quality rolls for Tech-related actions.
craft_upgrade_hardened_desc: Each PC gets +1 Trauma Box. This costs three upgrades to unlock, not just one. This may bring a PC with 4 traumas back into play if you wish.
craft_upgrade_military_harnesses_desc: You get 2 free load of weapons or armour. For example, you could wear a suit of light ballistic armour, or wield a heavy assault rifle, for zero load.
craft_upgrade_salvage_harnesses_desc: You get 2 free load of tools or gear. For example, you could carry a full maintenance kit & a hacking terminal, or wear a full suit of survival gear, for zero load.
craft_upgrade_stealth_harnesses_desc: 2 items carried are perfectly concealed. You could carry a hacking terminal and a blade or two, perfectly concealed.
dark_orb_core_upgrade_desc: Quantum computers whose operation causes a local violation of the Second Law of Thermodynamics, cooling themselves and their surroundings rather than heating as they work. The craft generates no heat signature, making it undetectable to most scanners.
dark_orb_xp_condition: You executed a successful stealth, subversion, or theft operation.
fight_description: Fight an opponent in close combat; assault or hold a position; brawl and wrestle.
fill_fields: Fill in sheet fields automatically upon entering or changing playbook or craft type
flexible_width: Flexible character sheet width (adapts to container)
forgotten_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with stealth or misdirection.
guts_description: As in blood and guts. Violence and physciality.
hack_description: Hack a computer system or piece of machinery in order to subvert, destroy, sabotage, or radically modify it; disable security.
hunt_description: Hunt a target; gather information about its location and movements; attack with precision shooting from a distance.
item_+heavy_desc: The addition of flak armour, ablative shielding, a helmet, etc.
item_a_blade_or_two_desc: Man, you've got knives, you've got sharp sticks...
item_a_large_weapon_desc: A weapon meant for two hands. A spear, an assault rifle, a coilgun.
item_a_sidearm_desc: A pistol or similar. Can be fired with one hand. Usually short range.
item_an_unusual_weapon_desc: A curiosity or tool turned into a weapon. A mono-filament whip, a fire-axe, a length of chain, a nail-gun, a welding element.
item_armour_desc: Basic body armour. Woven ballistic mesh, rubber, leather.
item_hacking_tools_desc: For bypassing security and subverting systems; encrypted console, bugs, virus programs, password breakers.
item_hand_scanner_desc: Compact unit for wide spectrum scanning and communication.
item_pressure_suit_desc: Don't go into hard vacuum without one.
item_survival_gear_desc: Rebreathers, filters, warm clothing, masks, gloves.
item_tech_tools_desc: For technical work; spanners, screwdrivers, welders, cutters.
killer_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with violence or coercion.
large_frame_blurb: Large (vehicle size, Scale 1+): A self-driving ground vehicle, a small self-piloting craft.
list_playbooks: The Broken, The Forgotten, The Killer, The Outlaw, The Pilot, The Witch.
medium_frame_blurb: Medium (human size, Scale 0): An artificial zoomorph, an android.
module_advanced_targeting_desc: +1 effect when fighting or hunting using the craft
module_afterburners_desc: Spend 1 Profit to inflict severe harm with the spitter drive's exhaust plume
module_cloning_vats_desc:
Can pay 2 Profit to grow a new body
for re-shell upon death
module_counter_causal_computing_desc: Spend 1 Profit to take 0 stress on a flashback
module_covert_entry_pods_desc: Your cohorts have their own small stealth crafts
module_data_war_matrix_desc: +1d to analyse or hack throughthe craft
module_diagnostic_matrix_desc: +1d to scan or analyse through the craft
module_empathy_scrubbers_desc: Take -1 stress when you do the math
module_hazardous_materials_storage_desc: Stockpiles give you +1d to acquire assets
module_lethe_field_generator_desc:
+1d engagement for stealth or
deception plans
module_military_hangar_desc: Weapons and combat vehicles from the light-fab cost half Profit
module_nanoswarm_desc: Penalties from Craft harm are one level less severe
module_precision_cutters_desc: The Gutter yields salvage at full Profit value of wreck
module_surplus_hangar_desc: Your cohorts have their own small salvage crafts
module_torsion_drive_desc: Take 1d craft stress to use the minimum Time Elapsed for travel
name: Name
operate_description: Operate computers or machinery as they were intended to be used; create, modify, or repair; communicate effectively with an AI or other machine life.
outlaw_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with tracking or violence.
pilot_description: Pilot a craft or vehicle; pull of daring stunts and tricky maneuvres; use a vehicle as a weapon.
pilot_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with the operational capabilities of your craft.
planet_splitter_core_upgrade_desc: Fires city-sized planet-splitter rounds, solid metal slugs that punch through crust and break tectonics, shattering worlds or pulverising craft. Each round costs 8 Profit and takes a month to load – the craft starts play with 1 round pre-loaded.
planet_splitter_xp_condition: You executed a successful battle, extortion, or war operation.
planningdesc: Choose a plan, provide the detail. Choose your load limit for the operation.
playbook_ability_agent_of_change_desc: When you do the math, you may avoid taking stress – instead, the action inflicts 2 Chaos.
playbook_ability_binary_senses_desc: You may expend your special armour to resist a consequence of fatigue, weakness, or technical malfunction, or to push yourself when working with technical skill.
playbook_ability_blank_desc: Whenever you interact with anyone, you may take 1 stress to ensure one of the following: they retain intense, disturbing memories of the encounter / they lose all memory of you and the encounter as soon as you've left.
playbook_ability_bleeding_edge_desc: When you invent or print a creation with hypertech features, take +1 result level to your roll. You begin with one hypertech design already known.
playbook_ability_close_to_the_metal_desc: You get +1d when you gather info for a score that's to take place aboard-craft.
playbook_ability_comforting_darkness_des: You never suffer harm due to decades spent out of coldsleep, so long as you spent that time exclusively aboard-craft.
playbook_ability_fractured_mind_desc: You can inhabit up to three separate bodies at once as a networked consciousness with a range of one orbit. Track harm separately for each. If one dies and the rest survive, you take 2 stress.
playbook_ability_from_hell's_heart_desc: When you take a devil's bargain, you get +2d instead of +1.
playbook_ability_grease_monkey_desc: Repairing vehicles and craft systems takes half the time it usually would.
playbook_ability_gunslinger_desc: You can push yourself to do one of the following: make a ranged attack against multiple targets in the blink of an eye / lock eyes and force the opposition to hesitate or falter.
playbook_ability_hard_target_desc: You may take 2 stress to name an exit and get the fuck our of here, right the hell now.
playbook_ability_hardened_killer_desc: Each trauma you have counts as a free special armour slot, which you can expend to resist consequences of physical harm or push yourself during a fight.
playbook_ability_implacable_desc: You may expend your special armour to resist consequences of surprise or mental harm, or to push yourself for ranged combat or tracking.
playbook_ability_interface_desc: When you're hooked up to a machine or computer system, you may push yourself to do one of the following: immediately take full control of a subsystem / wipe all traces of your tampering / deny access to all other users for as long as you need.
playbook_ability_jury_rig_desc: You may ignore the Profit cost of using the light-fab once per session, and can operate weapons, vehicles, or machinery that would be otherwise unusable due to harm or wear.
playbook_ability_living_weapon_desc: Your artificial familiar is a horrifying technological chimera. It gains potency when hunting or fighting, and gains a special function: cloaking, mind-link, or supersonic speed. Take this ability again to choose an additional special function for your familiar.
playbook_ability_master_tactician_desc: When you scan the site of a future violent action, take +1d. When you act on any information you learn as a result, you also get +1 effect.
playbook_ability_mercurial_desc: You may partially or fully change your Look whenever you want. Those who know you can still recognise you, but only if they look closely.
playbook_ability_mind_hack_desc: You can push yourself to remotely hack someone's Panhuman neural hardware, with one of the following effects: create illusory sensory stimuli / steal memories / implant false memories / inflict mental harm.
playbook_ability_monomania_desc: Name a thing you're seeking or hunting. You gain an additional xp trigger: You struggled with your monomania. If another crew member struggled with you, they also mark xp.
playbook_ability_not_to_be_trifled_with_: You can push yourself to do one of the following: perform a feat of physical force that verges on the superhuman / temporarily count as Scale 2 in close combat.
playbook_ability_odin_desc: You know the trick to interacting with AIs and other machine intelligences as if they were human. You gain potency when interacting with machine life.
playbook_ability_one_shot,_one_kill_desc: You can pinpoint anyone's weakness and exploit it. When you commit violence against a single Scale 0 target, you always kill on a hit, no matter your effect or the harm involved.
playbook_ability_one_with_the_void_desc: You may expend your special armour to resist a craft- or space- related consequence, or to push yourself for a craft manoeuvre.
playbook_ability_orbital_ballet_desc: You gain +1d to analyse a potential flight plan for a score. You get +1d to the engagement roll for that operation.
playbook_ability_patient_zero_desc: You can push yourself to do one of the following: unleash a swarm of nanomachines as a weapon – use nanomachines to twist objects in your immediate vicinity into grotesque, unnatural, or obstructive forms.
playbook_ability_pulling_the_threads_des: You can operate on people to repair, diagnose, dismantle, or read them like you would with a machine or computer.
playbook_ability_red_leader_desc: When you command a squadron of Aces in combat, they continue to fight when they would otherwise break (they're not taken out when they suffer level 3 harm). They gain +1 effect and 1 armour.
playbook_ability_reflexes_desc: When there's a question about who acts first, the answer is you (two characters with Reflexes act simultaneously).
playbook_ability_scary_motherfucker_desc: Take +1d when you use threats or coercion and back it up with an obvious show of force.
playbook_ability_scrubbed_emotions_desc: Once per session, you may take 0 stress when you do the math.
playbook_ability_serial_desc: When you kill in cold blood, you may roll 1d and clear that amount of stress. If you roll over your current stress, also choose one of the following: you must kill again / take a trophy / desecrate the corpse / posture and boast.
playbook_ability_slowed_metabolism_desc: You get +1d when you take months or more to perform an action, and any harm taken from failing life support counts as one level less severe.
playbook_ability_smooth_operator_desc: When you and the crew successfully do a job for someone and make it to the payoff, they pay you +2 Profit.
playbook_ability_symbiosis_desc: When you externalise your stress, the craft only takes on half of the total externalised. In addition, you may take a downtime action to take on craft stress.
playbook_ability_tabula_rasa_desc: When you try to lie to or convince someone of something, no matter the result, they must choose one: become intensely fixated upon you / let slip a terrible secret.
playbook_ability_the_carriage_held_but_j: The Carriage Held But Just Ourselves
You always have a running neural backup and cloned body ready to go. When you die, you may spend 1 Profit to immediately re-shell into this backup.
playbook_ability_the_churn_desc: Take 2 stress to roll the system's Chaos level (or the Craft's damage) instead of an action rating. Say how you use the present chaos to your advantage.
playbook_ability_the_flesh_is_weak_desc: Penalties from harm are one level less severe (though level 4 harm is still fatal).
playbook_ability_the_smell_of_napalm_des: When you act through a craft, vehicle, or war-shell with the intent to commit violence, it operates at +1 Scale.
playbook_ability_the_subtle_knife_desc: When you kill, it is always quietly, and you may choose whether or not you leave any obvious marks.
playbook_ability_thick_as_thieves_desc: During downtime, if you're on a populous world or orbital, you get +1 result level when you acquire an asset, and +1 effect when you gather info.
playbook_ability_vector_desc: When you touch someone, panhuman or otherwise, you may take 1 stress to plant an instruction in their mind. They must follow this instruction or else take level 3 harm, “Infected.”
playbook_ability_vessel_desc: A dangerous AI has taken up residence in your mind. If you sacrifice a part of your self (a memory, a dream, a personality tick) to it, it can do one of the following: assist you on an action roll – absorb 1d6 stress for you. However, the AI has its own priorities and goals. You have been warned.
playbook_ability_veteran_desc: Choose a special ability from another source (can be taken more than once).
playbook_ability_walking_corpse_desc: You are invisible to all artificial scans, from thermal cameras to robotic eyes. Take 2 stress to cause organics to avert their gaze and fail to observe you for a few moments.
playbook_ability_war_criminal_desc: When you do the math to commit violence at or above Scale 5, take -1 stress.
playbook_ability_zero_history_desc: All record of you has been wiped from Panhuman society, and any new records made quickly become corrupted and unusable. You get +1d to infiltrate an organisation or deceive an electronic as to your identity.
playbook_item_a_mass_of_hidden_blades_de: There's a lot of them, and they're very sharp, and they'd all very much like to meet you personally.
playbook_item_ancient_war_shell_desc: A bulky suit of powered armour, scarred by countless battles. A miniature weapon of mass destruction, nuclear-armed and sealed against hard vacuum. Is it chunky and functional, or sleek and elegant? Does it bear the iconography of some long-defunct empire, or the arms of some putrescent noble house? Is its countenance menacing, or unnervingly friendly?
playbook_item_artificial_familiar_desc: A vat-grown or robotic, specially-designed animal, highly intelligent and deeply loyal. Obeys your commands and anticipates your actions. Cohort (Expert: Creepy Familiar).
playbook_item_bandolier_of_explosives_de: A wide belt of grenades or remote detonation charges.
playbook_item_concealed_holdout_pistol_d: Something for special occasions. Either mounted on a spring- loaded mount, or else hidden in a boot or the lining of a coat.
playbook_item_concealed_sidearm_desc: Something for special occasions. A holdout pistol or the like on a spring- loaded mount, or else hidden in a boot or the lining of a coat.
playbook_item_corrupted_data_orb_desc: A dull glass orb filled with membrane, carrying corrupted, virulent data. What data does it carry? What digital disease curdles in its depths?
playbook_item_craft_schematics_desc: Detailed factory-spec blueprints for your craft or others.
playbook_item_drone_assistant_desc: A loyal robotic companion that can store tools and help with the heavy lifting. Is it a lumbering power lifter? A crab-walker? A buzzing mass of rotor-blades and circular saws?
playbook_item_fine_ancient_pressure_suit: An old and finely crafted pressure suit, made to a template no longer used. What fetishes or talismans adorn its lining? Is that blood dried into the sleeve, or something else?
playbook_item_fine_antique_sidearm_desc: An old-fashioned gun from a more enlightened age. Is it dented and scuffed from wear, or kept in pristine condition? What's carved into the grip? Who did it used to belong to?
playbook_item_fine_bypass_chip_desc: A finely crafted sliver of membrane and neural interface software slotted into the brain or a piece of hacking hardware, able to process and crack military- grade encryption with relative efficiency. Bypass chips are tightly controlled or outlawed entirely on most civilised worlds. Where did you get yours? Who'd you have to kill?
playbook_item_fine_coilgun_desc: A handheld mass driver, propelling fat metal spikes with a series of electromagnetic coils. Quiet and deadly.
playbook_item_fine_flight_suit_desc: A finely crafted, padded flight suit designed for freedom of movement in microgravity, and filled with pockets and loops for odds and ends, and ports and inlaid circuitry for hooking up to craft systems. Can double as a pressure suit in a pinch. Who's name is under the collar? How badly does it need washing?
playbook_item_fine_hacking_tools_desc: Finely crafted terminals, cracking software, and discrete umbilicals for hooking into encrypted systems.
playbook_item_fine_hand_scanner_desc: A finely crafted scanning unit for picking out hidden things and strange signals. Does it give off blips like a beating heart? Does it feed directly into your brain via umbilicals?
playbook_item_fine_hand_weapon_or_sidear: A finely crafted one-handed weapon. A well-balanced blade, a well-oiled high-calibre pistol, etc.
playbook_item_fine_heavy_weapon_desc: A finely crafted two-handed weapon of your choice, melee or otherwise. An iron cudgel, a big fuck-off blade, a rifle, an LMG, etc.
playbook_item_fine_personal_craft_desc: A cramped one- or two-man transatmospheric fighter craft. Is it sleek, or snub-nosed? What noise does it make when it cuts through atmosphere? What decorations have you strewn about the cockpit? What's painted on the side?
playbook_item_fine_sidearm_desc: A finely crafted pistol, designed for use in the tight corridors of a craft.
playbook_item_fine_stealth_suit_desc: A finely crafted compact full-body suit capable of mimicking its surroundings and concealing its wearer. Is it an intelligent-cloth catsuit? A small-profile suit of matte hard-shell? A high-tech invisibility cloak?
playbook_item_fine_subtle_weapon_desc: Nothing so brash or brutish as a sword or slug-thrower. Something finely crafted, sharp and deadly, and quick to draw. A needle gun, a mono-filament whip, a garotte, a diamond-edged knife, an invisible UV or IR laser projector, etc.
playbook_item_fine_survival_gear_desc: A finely crafted set of clothing and life support gear for braving the worst environments. Is it a high-tech hazardous environment suit? Furs and trailing cables? A death's-head gas mask?
playbook_item_fine_tech_tools_desc: A finely crafted set of tools for technical work. Did you design them yourself for specific work, or did you steal them from someone long-dead? Is it a modular multi-tool, or a hodgepodge of random tools tossed in a case?
playbook_item_fine_unusual_weapon_desc: A finely crafted curiosity or tool customised for darker purposes.
playbook_item_fine_vicious_blade_desc: A nasty, sharp thing, nonetheless finely crafted, with a distinctly sacrificial look.
playbook_item_full_spectrum_optics_desc: A set of optics, usually bulky goggles, capable of seeing into the radioactive, ultraviolet, and microwave wavelengths, as well as powerful zooming and image enhancement.
playbook_item_knockout_gas_desc: A powerful sedative in aerosol form. For quick escapes.
playbook_item_manacles_and_cable_ties_de: A set of heavy magnetically-locked manacles, plus some reinforced plastic and metal cable ties, the kind you can only remove with a power tool.
playbook_item_nanomachine_swarm_desc: Thousands of tiny machines, occasionally listening to your whispers. Do they live in your clothes, under your skin, or in you blood-stream? What was their original purpose, the one you've overridden?
playbook_item_primitive_game_set_desc: A set of dice, cards, bones, or the like, likely for gambling, probably loaded in your favour.
playbook_item_radiation_meds_desc: Drugs for staving off the worst effects of radiation, essential for working in the volatile, contaminated environment of an old spitter craft.
playbook_item_scary_weapon_or_tool_desc: A scary-looking hand weapon or tool. The item grants increased effect when you intimidate, not increased harm in combat. A chainsaw, a drill, a bloodied boarding axe, a welder, a circular saw, etc.
playbook_item_system_charts_desc: Comprehensive charts displaying orbital data, gravity wells, and other useful information for a navigator. Are they high-tech membrane models, or old-fashioned paper in vacuum-sealed plastic?
playbook_item_utility_belt_desc: A hefty belt or backpack filled with odds and ends. When you use a utility belt slot, you may take one useful item from it, such as scrap, spare parts, a specific computer or machine component, or a small, highly-specialised gadget of your own design. Each belt has 3 slots.
query_for_consequence: Query for consequence name when resisting
recoveryblurb: Get treatment in downtime to activate your healing project clock
resist_instructions: Suffer 6 stress minus the highest die result. When you roll a critical on resistance, clear 1 stress.
savvy_description: Savvy: Wits and streetwise know-how. Coercion and subtle manipulation.
scan_description: Scan an area or situation to understand what's going on; look for something useful or dangerous; sense trouble before it happens; gather information about opportunities or exploits.
scramble_description: Scramble across rough ground or up a sheer surface; traverse obstacles; climb, swim, run, jump, and tumble.
show_broadcast: Show broadcast buttons for sending information to chat
show_cohort_section: Show cohort section on character sheet
show_outline: Show outline for active input fields
small_frame_blurb: Small (cat size, Scale 0): A metal orb, a mechanical spider.
sneak_description: Sneak about unseen and act without suspicion; hide yourself; conceal something; perform sleight of hand.
sway_description: Sway someone with charm, logic, deception, disguise, or bluff; change attitudes or behaviour with manipulation or seduction.
systems_description: Cold calculation and powers of observation. Breaking complex things apart and putting them back together.
upgrade_armor_desc: When the craft takes harm, crew-members aboard take harm at one level lower than normal. The second Armour upgrade nullifies all harm through to the crew.
upgrade_brig_desc: The Core has secure holding cells housing their own dedicated coldsleep capsules – perfect places to keep prisoners and undesirables.
upgrade_mastery_desc: Your crew has access to master level training aboard the craft. You may advance your PCs' action ratings to 4 (until you unlock this upgrade, PC action ratings are capped at 3).
upgrade_security_desc: The Core has a dedicated security sub-system, including cameras, armed drones, and blast doors. The second Security upgrade makes the Core nigh-impregnable to all but an overwhelming force.
upgrade_storage_desc: Each Storage upgrade provides the craft with two extra boxes of Profit storage.
upgrade_training_desc: You earn 2 xp instead of 1 when you train the xp track indicated during downtime.
upgrade_weapons_desc: The Core has a weapon command blister installed, awakening the craft's dormant weapon systems (directed-energy cannons, missile batteries, etc.), allowing the craft to inflict harm at a distance.
upgrade_workshop_desc: The Core's light-fab has a special workshop embedded in its inner workings, providing a workspace for using blueprints and designing tech, complete with diagnostic tools, spare parts, and so on. When operating the light-fab, you get +1d.
use_kirsty: Use Kirsty font if installed (only check if you have Kirsty)
utility_belts_blurb: When you use a utility belt slot, you may take one useful item from it, such as scrap, spare parts, a specific computer or machine component, or a small, highly specialised gadget of your own design.
witch_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with manipulation or mayhem.
xp_beliefs: You expressed your beliefs, drives, biology, or background.
xp_craft_specific: Enter your craft's specific way to mark XP here.
xp_craft_trauma: You struggled with the craft's traumas.
xp_desperate: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark xp in that action's attribute.
xp_express: Express the goals, drives, inner conflict, or essential nature of the crew.
xp_specific: Enter your playbook's specific way to mark XP here.
xp_specific_extra: Enter another specific way to mark XP here.
xp_top: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (or instead mark 2 xp if that item occurred multiple times).
xp_trauma: You struggled with issues from your trauma.
zerodice: Zero Dice — take the lowest result above
